org.eclipse.keyple.core.card.selection

Class CardSelectionsResult

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.core.card.selection.CardSelectionsResult

  • public final class CardSelectionsResult
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the result of a selection process.

    Embeds a map of AbstractSmartCard. At most one of these matching card is active.
    Provides a set of methods to retrieve the active selection (getActiveSmartCard) or a particular matching card specified by its index.

    Since:
    0.9

    • Method Detail

      • getActiveSmartCard

        public AbstractSmartCard getActiveSmartCard()
        Get the active matching card. I.e. the card that has been selected.
        The hasActiveSelection method should be called before.
        Returns:
        the currently active matching card
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no active matching card is found
        Since:
        0.9

      • getSmartCards

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,AbstractSmartCard> getSmartCards()
        Gets all the AbstractSmartCard corresponding to all selection cases in a map where the key is the selection index.
        Returns:
        A map
        Since:
        0.9

      • getSmartCard

        public AbstractSmartCard getSmartCard(int selectionIndex)
        Gets the AbstractSmartCard for the specified index.

        Returns null if no AbstractSmartCard was found.

        Parameters:
        selectionIndex - the selection index
        Returns:
        the AbstractSmartCard or null
        Since:
        0.9

      • hasActiveSelection

        public boolean hasActiveSelection()
        Tells if the current selection process resulted in an active selection.
        Returns:
        true if an active selection is present
        Since:
        0.9

      • hasSelectionMatched

        public boolean hasSelectionMatched(int selectionIndex)
        Get the matching status of a selection case for which the index is provided.
        Checks for the presence of an entry in the AbstractSmartCard Map for the given index
        Parameters:
        selectionIndex - the selection index
        Returns:
        true if the selection has matched
        Since:
        0.9

      • getActiveSelectionIndex

        public int getActiveSelectionIndex()
        Gets the index of the active selection
        Returns:
        the index as an int
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no active selection
        Since:
        0.9
